comments:
I20031209 (11:37)
- not sure how to reproduce this one but here are the steps I think I took
- load UI plugins from CVS
- load remaining plugins as binary
- compile - works fine
- run Eclipse within Eclipse
- import an example project 
- in Java perspective/Package Explorer view, right click on an xml file
- I got the following crash:

Debbie, can you attach the class file in question from the bin directory in your
workspace? (org/eclipse/ui/actions/SimpleWildcardTester.class).  This could be a
compiler error

Created an attachment (id=7101)
SimpleWildcardTester class file

SimpleWildCardTester.class file as requested :-)
The file you attached is a gif file (a picture of a little blue down arrow)...

The file has been re-compiled as a side effect of something else I did and is 
no longer a little blue down arrow.  I suspect this may be part of a corrupt 
disk problem I've been having.  As a result, I'm closing this bug.  Sorry for 
the spew.

I'm noticing a pattern here - it seems this only happens with files being 
brought down from the CVS repositories.  As a result, Steve has changed 
my 'port' and we will try that for a while to see if it doesn't help.

I spoke with someone else recently who had noticed incorrect attachments in
bugzilla (i.e., attachment numbers getting mixed up and associated with the
wrong bug).  So, maybe you're not going crazy after all <g>.
